title.narrative: GGGI - Global Green Growth- development of adaptation and reduction strategies in developing countries

description.narrative: Denmark joined GGGI in 2011, and provided DKK 90 mill. during the 2011-2013 period. In 2014, Denmark renewed its engagement with GGGI and provided a contribution of DKK 90 mill. for the 2014-2016 period. Denmark's financial support is provided as a core contribution. The contribution is made available to help GGGI achieve its overall mandate and goals, rather than being available for specific elements of GGGI's work program. GGGI's vision is that the world makes a paradigm shift to 'green growth', a model of economic growth that simultaneously achieves poverty reduction, job creation, social inclusion as well as environmental sustainability and resource security. GGGI's mission is to advance the practice and theory of green growth by helping to develop, implement and deepen understanding of green growth strategies. GGGI's vision and mission correspond well with the Denmark's strategic green growth priority. In 2014, GGGI adopted a strategic plan for 2015-2020, which operates with three main objectives: - strengthening national, sub-national, and local green growth plans; - promoting green investment flows; - knowledge sharing between countries on green growth. In relation to developing and implementing GGGI's strategic plan, Denmark has set the following priorities: 1) Development of a focused and realistic strategic plan with a concrete results framework; 2) Poverty orientation; 3) Inclusiveness; 4) Consolidation of GGGI's activities; 5) Integration of GGGI's three work streams; 6) An organisational structure that is fit for purpose; 7) Implementation of financial and administrative policies, rules and procedures of international standards; 8) Influence at the global level.
